revised_title: Sperm Competition Games: Strategies for Sperm Size and Number
tldr: This article explores the evolutionary games of sperm competition, where two males mate with the same female, and how both sperm size and number can be strategically controlled by the diploid parent. The study finds that sperm size is independent of the risk of sperm competition, and only sperm numbers increase with this risk. The findings challenge previous models that assumed constant and unimportant sperm size in determining fertilization success.
